article.headline: Hampton 64, Morgan State 63
article.story: BALTIMORE (AP) -- Chris Grant made a wild 3-pointer at the buzzer to give Morgan State a 64-63 victory over Hampton in a Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference game Monday. Grant hit a running one-handed shot from about 35 feet that bounced three times off the rim and backboard before going in. The crowd at Hill Field House raced on to the court as Morgan State (7-10, 6-4 MEAC) ended its two-game losing streak. Grant finished with a game-high 24 points, going 4-for-5 from 3-point range and 10-for-13 from the free-throw line, as Morgan State rebounded from blowing an 11-point second-half lead. Bruce Brown led Hampton (8-13, 6-4) with 14 points. The Pirates led for nearly the entire first half before the Bears took charge after the break. The game was tied at 34 at halftime, but Hampton was cold for the first several minutes of the second half and Morgan State twice took 11-point leads.
